MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION

License #: CB810201161

Agency Name: HANDS ACROSS THE WATER

Suite 200
ANN ARBOR, MI 48108-8959

License Expiration Date: 08/10/2025

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
Section • (1) An agency shall develop service plans with the child,
Description the child's parents or legal guardian, the referring agency,
and other parties involved in providing needed services, or
1

medical care, unless the agency documents why any of the
entities have not been involved.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency is not providing services and resources to family due
to personal feelings.
Investigation Parent was not interviewed. Attempts were made to contact her
via telephone on July 15, 2025, and July 23, 2025. Voicemails
were left requesting a return call with no response received to
date. Email contact was made on July 16, 2025. No response has
been received.
Foster Care supervisor (FC supervisor) was interviewed via
telephone on July 17, 2025. FC supervisor stated the agency
has provided Parent with a crib, air mattresses, clothes, and
multiple baby items. FC supervisor stated Parent has not
assembled or installed the crib that was provided. The agency has
repeatedly inquired about whether or not Parent needs anything
and she states she doesn’t. The agency attempted to schedule 2
FTM’s last month and Parent was invited but did not attend.
Parent was asked if she would prefer to meet individually instead
of the FTM and she didn’t respond.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
July 18, 2025. FCW stated the agency has provided Mother with
a crib, pack and play, baby walker, clothes, toys, diapers and
other items from Foster Care Closet. She has also provided her
with resources to apply for child care, housing/rental assistance
and parenting classes and offered to assist in applying or filling
out paperwork. Parent has reported to FCW not needing any
assistance with resources.
Documents reviewed:
• MISACWIS case file. March 21, 2025, Updated Service
Plan (USP) states FCW provided Parent with a highchair,
pack and play, crib and baby gate. June 18, 2025, USP
states FCW provided Parent with air mattresses,
employment resources, food resources, housing resources
and parent education resources/services. Service plans
also document multiple attempts to contact Parent and
minimal response received.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as interviews and
documentation within the MISACWIS case file support the agency
has provided Parent with resources.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
2

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person
Section contact
Description • (3) An agency shall facilitate in-person contact between
parents and children except where parental rights have
been terminated or when there is a court determination that
visits are detrimental to the child.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency is not providing visitation with children as required.
Investigation Parent was not interviewed. Attempts were made to contact her
via telephone on July 15, 2025, and July 23, 2025. Voicemails
were left requesting a return call with no response received to
date. Email contact was made on July 16, 2025. No response has
been received.
Foster Care supervisor (FC supervisor) was interviewed via
telephone on July 17, 2025. Parent has 6 children in care and
there are two different jurisdictions involved, both with the same
assigned FC supervisor and FCW. FC supervisor stated Parent
has a lengthy history of mental health issues. Visits have been
very inconsistent throughout the case. There have been short
periods of time when Parent exercises her visits and then will go
for a long stretch where she does not confirm or communicate
with the agency. There have been instances when the agency
transports the baby and upon arrival at Parent’s home she will
state she doesn’t want to visit today.
FC supervisor stated the court orders state the agency has
discretion to allow supervised or unsupervised parenting time
including overnights. There was a period when Parent was
consistent with visits towards the end of last year and beginning of
this year. Due to the consistency at the time the agency shifted
visits to be weekend unsupervised. Once that occurred Parent
participated in 2-3 visits and then would not communicate with the
agency to confirm visits. The agency made every effort to
communicate with her to see if she needed anything and Parent
would not respond.
FC supervisor stated Parent’s biggest barrier is her mental health.
The agency has not received confirmation she is attending
therapy and taking her prescribed medication in quite some time.
Due to ongoing mental health concerns and the inconsistency with
unsupervised parenting time the agency decided it would be best
to move the visits to supervised. There were also concerns with
Parent’s housing because at one point she reported she would be
3

losing her housing and the due to lack of contact the agency did
not have confirmation she still had appropriate housing. The
agency reached out to inquire if she needed any resources or
referrals to address housing and Parent did not respond. Due to
not knowing the current status of her housing and not having a
report in 2-3 months regarding parenting time the agency decided
it wasn’t safe to allow overnight unsupervised visits to continue
until they knew the current status and could ensure child safety. In
addition, since Parent had been so inconsistent with parenting
time the agency had not been able to supervise the required
monthly parenting time. FC supervisor stated the agency is
responsible for reporting to the court how parenting times are
going and up to this point they haven’t been able to do that due to
Parent’s inconsistency and lack of communication. At the last
court hearing the agency was directed by the court to schedule an
FTM to discuss parenting time due to the court being concerned
with the unsupervised parenting time and Parent’s pattern of
inconsistency.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on
July 18, 2025. She stated Parent has two different court cases
involving 2 different counties however she is the assigned FCW
for both cases. FCW stated Parent has not been consistent with
visits. There has been an ongoing pattern of not confirming visits
and not communicating with the agency.
FCW stated visits had been overnight, unsupervised but due to
the ongoing concerns with Parent’s mental health and inconsistent
parenting time the agency moved the visits back to supervised.
In addition, FCW stated the agency is not sure the status of
Parent’s housing. Approximately one month ago Parent reported
she was unsure if she would be able to maintain her housing due
to being behind in rent and utilities.
Documents reviewed:
• All court orders from May 2024 through the most recent
court order in May 2025 state the agency has discretion to
allow unsupervised or supervised parenting time up to and
including overnights.
• MISCASWIS case file. September 24, 2024-June 18, 2025,
USP’s include multiple social work contacts documenting
FCW attempting to contact Parent to schedule/confirm
parenting time and not receiving a response.
• FTM’s to discuss case status. Parent did not attend FTM’s
held on May 6, 2025, and June 16, 2025. Parent attended
FTM held on July 9, 2025.
4

Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on completed
interviews and review of MISACWIS case file the agency has
discretion, per the court order, to provide supervised or
unsupervised parenting time. The MISACWIS case file includes
multiple social work contacts on behalf of FCW to contact Parent
to schedule/confirm parenting time and the majority of the time no
response is received.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
_______7/25/2025___________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 12, 2025
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
Area Manager
